chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to start?
hi, yes
alrighty, i'm at the startup point and see a twig leading to an island with a tiger
which way to go?
keep going straight
ok cool, now i'm on the tiger's island
so, what's next?
keep going straight to the bird island
got it, i'm on the big island with the parrot
where to now?
go across the stones to the frog island
alright, i'm at the frog's place now
what's next?
go across the alligator to get to the next island
i'm past the crocodile and back with the elephant now
where should i head next?
go to the island with the giraffe
i'm hanging out with the giraffe now
go across the twig to the snake island
i see the snake, i hope it's not venomous! where to next?
go the treasure on that island with the snake
i'm at the treasure! *finished* thanks for the guidance!

chat.msg: hey there, estas listo?
hi, i'm ready
awesome! first off, head a few steps left, you should see a wooden bench. after you pass it, cross the trail aiming for the florist stand
but don't worry, we're not heading there. make a swift 180 turn to your left before reaching it and cross the trail again, heading back towards the white dog where you began. got it?
ok, now where do i go
now, skip over the branch towards the south, keep going
you should spot another white cute dog by a red and white checkered picnic mat. are you there yet?
yes, i'm there
sweet! now, go over the picnic mat
feel free to step over those berries, and continue straight ahead to the west
ok, now where do i go
now, you should see another branch over the river
let's cross it, shall we? this time we're heading back up north
i'm there
great job! now see that green bush over there? go around it from the right, continue until you reach the florist stand
ok, i'm there
good job! now take a left turn, go underneath the stand and press onwards towards a big bridge
you see it? there are two people cycling on it
i'm across the bridge
great! just after the bridge, there are two adorable elderly folks on a bench, engrossed in their newspapers. keep heading south for a few steps
you should be between the old folks and a wooden branch now. sound good so far?
good, now where
next! continue towards the green bush right at the end of that wooden branch you see
you're doing great!
i'm there
you're almost there! go east now, crossing between the branch and the bush
keep going!

chat.msg: hey!!! ya comenzamos?
hi, yes, go towards the dog
alright, walking south towards the dog now
what's next?
go towards the fire pit
gotcha, walking towards the fire pit
what's next?
go down the trail to the car
on it, heading south to the blue car now
what's next, boss?
go down to the telescope
okay, heading south to the telescope now
go to the brown cabin
roger that, heading west to the wooden house now *finished*

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to start?
hi, i'm ready
awesome! from the three palm trees where you are, head south-west under the first one. turn right to cross the second tree, then take a sharp left before the third tree
continue your journey southwards. how's it going so far?
ok, i'm there
great, now we're going to veer left, just around that brown puppy
then, take a comfy turn towards the right heading south. get ready for the next step!
ok, now where
cool! now see those rocks? walk between the big rock on the left and the small rock on your right
you'll reach the ocean. ready to get your feet wet?
ok, i'm there
alright then, time to meet mr. crab! enter the water until you see the big red crab
with him to your left, turn to your right and move along the big rock. how's the water temperature?
ok, now where
stay on the path by the water and go westward
you'll spot a medium rock. continue along
ok, got it
now where do i go
are you still there
right in front of you, is a shark
don't panic! take sharp turn to your right
certainly, buddy! now body-surf back to the land
you're going to squeeze between the medium rock and a beach ball with blue, yellow and white stripes. off you go!

Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: i like it, it is nice to talk in a language only you two know
